alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 23 at 10:38PM CST until January 26 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Louisiana, including the following parishes, Bienville, Bossier, Caddo, Claiborne, Lincoln and Webster and northeast Texas, including the following counties, Cass, Harrison and Marion. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1038 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Marshall, Minden, Springhill, Homer, Vivian, Hallsville, Haughton, Greenwood, Arcadia, Blanchard, Haynesville, Waskom, Jefferson, Linden, Benton, Ringgold, Sibley and Cullen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
